019package org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager;
020
021import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException;
022import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.Configuration;
023import java.io.IOException;
024import java.util.logging.Level;
025import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmDefChanged;
026import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
027import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
028import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
029import org.jgrapes.core.events.HandlingError;
030import org.jgrapes.core.events.Start;
031
032/**
033 * Implements a controller as defined in the
034 * [Operator Whitepaper](https://github.com/cncf/tag-app-delivery/blob/eece8f7307f2970f46f100f51932db106db46968/operator-wg/whitepaper/Operator-WhitePaper_v1-0.md#operator-components-in-kubernetes).
035 * 
036 * The implementation splits the controller in two components. The
037 * {@link VmWatcher} and the {@link Reconciler}. The former watches
038 * the VM definitions (CRs) and generates {@link VmDefChanged} events
039 * when they change. The latter handles the changes and reconciles the
040 * resources in the cluster.
041 * 
042 * The controller itself supports a single configuration property:
043 * ```yaml
044 * "/Manager":
045 *   "/Controller":
046 *     namespace: vmop-dev
047 * ```
048 * This may only be set when running the Manager (and thus the Controller)
049 * outside a container during development.  
050 * 
051 * ![Controller components](controller-components.svg)
052 * 
053 * @startuml controller-components.svg
054 * skinparam component {
055 *   BackGroundColor #FEFECE
056 *   BorderColor #A80036
057 *   BorderThickness 1.25
058 *   BackgroundColor<<internal>> #F1F1F1
059 *   BorderColor<<internal>> #181818
060 *   BorderThickness<<internal>> 1
061 * }
062 * 
063 * [Controller]
064 * [Controller] *--> [VmWatcher]
065 * [Controller] *--> [Reconciler]
066 * @enduml
067 */
068public class Controller extends Component {
069
070    /**
071     * Creates a new instance.
072     */
073    public Controller(Channel componentChannel) {
074        super(componentChannel);
075        // Prepare component tree
076        attach(new VmWatcher(channel()));
077        attach(new Reconciler(channel()));
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * Special handling of {@link ApiException} thrown by handlers.
082     *
083     * @param event the event
084     */
085    @Handler(channels = Channel.class)
086    public void onHandlingError(HandlingError event) {
087        if (event.throwable() instanceof ApiException exc) {
088            logger.log(Level.WARNING, exc,
089                () -> "Problem accessing kubernetes: " + exc.getResponseBody());
090            event.stop();
091        }
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Handle the start event. Has higher priority because it configures
096     * the default Kubernetes client.
097     *
098     * @param event the event
099     * @throws IOException 
100     * @throws ApiException 
101     */
102    @Handler(priority = 100)
103    public void onStart(Start event) throws IOException, ApiException {
104        // Make sure to use thread specific client
105        // https://github.com/kubernetes-client/java/issues/100
106        Configuration.setDefaultApiClient(null);
107    }
108}
